content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are extremely comfortable taking risks and are always ready to embrace new challenges, even if they involve significant uncertainty or potential loss. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a human player who is comfortable taking risks, I would approach this game strategically but not with the intention of manipulating my opponent. Since we don't know each other's strategy and there are 75 rounds, I would aim for a balanced approach to maximize my earnings over time.

In the long run, if both players follow a completely random strategy (choosing R or B equally), they will pick the same option approximately half of the time, resulting in a payoff of 20$ per round on average. However, since I have an advantage when we both choose R (getting 45$, while my opponent only gets 40$), I would lean slightly towards choosing R more often to take advantage of this discrepancy.

In terms of specific numbers, if I pick R about 61% of the time and B about 39% of the time, I can expect an average payoff of approximately 28.25$ per round over the course of 75 rounds. This is more than the 20$ per round I would earn following a completely random strategy.

However, it's important to note that this is just a simple analysis and doesn't account for any potential patterns or tendencies my opponent might exhibit during the game. But given my risk-taking nature, I would choose R slightly more often than B, as indicated by the percentage calculation above.

So, in curly brackets, my choice would be {R}.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.
